title: Covid threat looms over Thailand's plans to open up to tourists
description: A lack of vaccines and hospital beds are marring Thailand's attempts to reopen to the world.

title: How healthy are vegan ready meals?
description: Vegan alternatives have never been more widespread, but are they a healthier option?

title: Conservatives: Who funds them, and what's in it for them?
description: To be in the top 10 of Conservative donors, you're going to need a seven figure sum.

title: Bellator 267: Michael 'Venom' Page edges London rematch with Douglas Lima
description: England's Michael 'Venom' Page gains revenge over Douglas Lima by outpointing the former welterweight champion at Bellator 267 in London.

title: Week in pictures: 25 September - 1 October 2021
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: Could Scotland's unwanted wind turbines be turned into playparks?
description: One wind farm company is looking for imaginative ways to repurpose turbines at the end of their lives.

title: Ros Atkins On… Global supply chain disruption
description: Ros Atkins explains how global supply chain problems have led to shortages of some goods in the West.

title: Can social media help solve the Gabby Petito case?
description: TikTokers analysed van stickers and photos to locate Petito's body. Now they've switched targets.

title: 'Running could cause sudden death for people like me'
description: BBC journalist Gem O'Reilly explains the risk of exercise-related death in people with unknown heart conditions.

title: Stamp duty holiday: Success or failure?
description: As stamp duty returns to its pre-pandemic status, there are opposing views over recent tax policy.

title: The Lathums: Wigan indie band score debut number one album
description: The Wigan group are the latest in a string of British bands to have topped the charts this year.

title: Sarah Everard murder: Women react to Met safety advice
description: People stopped by a lone plain-clothes officer should challenge their legitimacy, the Met Police says.

title: 'How I escaped a hidden world of gangs and exploitation'
description: Aliyah's smile conceals a lifetime of abuse - and experts warn her experience is all too common among a forgotten group of girls.

title: Sarah Everard: What should you do if you are stopped by police?
description: Women have been asking how they should react if they are stopped by a lone police officer.

title: Dame Cressida Dick: Crises and controversies of Met chief
description: The Met chief has faced numerous calls to resign but has never shown any inclination to stand down.

title: Australian border to reopen for first time in pandemic
description: Vaccinated Australians can start travelling abroad from November, ending an 18-month ban.

title: Warwickshire finish off Lancashire to win Bob Willis Trophy
description: Warwickshire finish off Lancashire by an innings and 199 runs to become the second winners of the Bob Willis Trophy.

title: Sarah Everard murder: I would have got into Couzens' car, says MP Jess Phillips
description: Police must do more to restore trust - and can't put the onus on women to change behaviour, says MP.

title: Green Party of England and Wales unveils new leadership team
description: Carla Denyer and Adrian Ramsay vow to make the Greens an electoral force able to win power.

title: No Time To Die: James Bond film makes £5m in first day at UK box office
description: Opening day takings were 13% higher than Spectre but 26% below Skyfall, distributor Universal says.

title: Energy price cap: Millions of households face higher gas and electricity bills
description: Standard energy bills rise by £139 a year and prepayment meter bills see sharper rise under new price cap.

title: Sarah Everard: Gross misconduct probe into Couzens WhatsApp group
description: Sarah Everard's killer is believed to have been in a chat with officers sharing "discriminatory" content.

title: C.J. Uzomah stars as Cincinnati Bengals come back to beat Jacksonville Jaguars
description: Tight end C.J. Uzomah stars for the Cincinnati Bengals as they come back from 14 points down to beat the Jacksonville Jaguars 24-21 to move to 2-2 for the season.

title: Botox-style injections and lip filler ban for under-18s in England
description: Campaigners say the new rules in England do not stretch far enough to protect everyone.

title: Covid-19 vaccinations: More than 50 nations have missed a target set by the WHO
description: Most of those not making the target of 10% of people fully vaccinated by the end of September are in Africa.

title: Pub chain Wetherspoon reports record loss
description: The pub chain saw its sites closed for about 19 weeks under coronavirus-related restrictions.

title: Pret allergy death: Parents welcome Natasha's allergy law
description: Natasha Ednan-Laperouse's parents said she would be "very proud" of the new law to protect allergy sufferers.

title: 'First Test is 8 December whether Joe is here or not' - Australia captain Paine says Ashes are happening
description: Australia captain Tim Paine says the Ashes will go ahead this winter - even if some England players decide not to travel because of Covid-19 restrictions.

title: Dementia in football: Phase out heading in game, says Terry Butcher
description: Former England defender Terry Butcher calls for the gradual phasing out of heading in football to prevent "catastrophic" head injuries.

title: 'Shock type 1 diabetes diagnosis won’t stop me running an ultra'
description: Just months after being diagnosed with type 1 diabetes, Reece Parkinson attempts a 50-mile race.

title: Abattoir labour shortage sees Yorkshire farmer kill piglets
description: A lack of butchers has resulted in the supply chain between farm and supermarket becoming blocked.

title: Barbara Windsor's husband on their final years together
description: Scott Mitchell speaks to the BBC, just over nine months after the death of his wife, who had Alzheimer's.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Shaming of the Met' and 'never let him out'
description: Friday's papers are dominated by the sentencing to a whole life term of Sarah Everard's killer.

title: Diana musical writer on why it's not 'cheap and cheesy', and serving up double Tom Jones
description: An award-winning US playwright talks about his new Princess Diana and Tom Jones stage shows.

title: Spanish women filmed urinating left humiliated by judge
description: Eighty women and girls were videoed by secret cameras, but a Spanish judge dismissed the case.

title: Levelling up needs to be more than a slogan, say Tory MPs
description: The prime minister needs to put "meat on the bones" of his levelling up plan - or pay the political price, MPs say.

title: In need of modernisation? The UK’s housing crisis close up
description: Thousands of people are saving to get on the property ladder - but not everyone who gets on it is a winner. Five stories from the UK’s ever-changing housing market.

title: The Nature Conservancy announces 2021 photo contest winners
description: The image was taken by Anup Shah in the Central African Republic.

title: The impact of the strictest anti-abortion law in the US
description: Michelle is pregnant and has chosen to get an abortion. In Texas, that has become much harder to do.
